name: Hell Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a four night half board short break package at Hell Bay (not cheap at £210 per person per night for a large bedroom). The price included helicopter transfer from Penzance to the neighbouring island of Tresco then a short boat trip across to Bryher where the hotel is situated.
reviews.title: Heaven at Hell Bay (eventually!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, we hadn't banked on the appalling weather which meant the helicpoter couldn't fly and the boat had already left for the day.
reviews.title: Hell Bay is an absolutely amazing UK destination
Contemporary and relaxed
reviews.text: Thankfully we managed to find a room (the last room!) at the Old Coastguard's Hotel in Mousehole and a special boat was put on the following day for the stranded helicopter and plane passengers (as the cloud was still too low). And thankfully again the hotel said they could add an extra night on at the end of our stay so we still had our four day break ahead of us.

The three hour boat journey on the Scillonian III was awful - we sat up on deck for three hours in the driving rain just to avoid all the ill passengers down below. Then the small launch (Firethorn) took over an hour to get to Bryher because of an extremely low tide.
reviews.title: Great weekend with the family

reviews.text: Despite all this we were in a surprisingly upbeat mood as we stepped ashore. We'd arrived for one thing. But we'd also arrived somewhere very different to the run of the mill places.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.text: We'd been staying very happily on Tresco for a few days at the delightful Island Hotel and were loathe to move on to our next booking at the Hell Bay. The welcome and the accommodation at the Tresco had been fantastic and although Bryher was supposed to be wilder and less touristy than Tresco, we were still dreading moving on to the unknown.
reviews.title: Chic Holiday Camp!
Awesome
reviews.text: After a short boat trip from Tresco to Bryher we were picked up by a friendly Newzealander and taken by landrover to the Hell Bay Hotel.

reviews.title: Expensive or what?
reviews.text: Our initial reaction wasn't favourable, probably because the weather had changed and the reception area felt cold and damp. However, once we saw our room, this soon changed to glee.

description: Hell Bay Hotel is an award winning hotel on the beautiful island of Bryher on the Isles of Scilly. Set in a picturesque cove facing the Atlantic Ocean, Hell Bay offers families and couples a friendly and private oasis to relax and spend quality time together and to enjoy the wild, natural delights of Bryher and the other islands of Scilly.
